thread.title: West Ham United vs. Chelsea, Premier League: Confirmed lineups
thread.title_full: West Ham United vs. Chelsea, Premier League: Confirmed lineups

author: David Pasztor
title: West Ham United vs. Chelsea, Premier League: Confirmed lineups
text:
Rec 
It's time! As with most games, this won't be easy. 
"This season we are showing we deserve to be top of the table but we want to continue to stay there. There are 12 games to play and anything can happen." -Antonio Conte; source: Chelsea FC 
Chelsea start the game with a 7-point lead at the top and 8 over Manchester City, who have a game-in-hand. 
Three more points would be nice. 
--- 
West Ham United starting lineup (4-2-3-1): Randolph | Cresswell, Reid, Fonte, Kouyate | Obiang, Noble (c) | Feghouli, Lanzini, Snodgrass | Carroll 
Substitutes from: Adrian, Byram, Masuaku, Collins, Feranndes, Ayew, Calleri 
Chelsea starting lineup (3-4-3): Courtois | Cahill (c), David Luiz, Azpilicueta | Alonso, Fabregas, Kante, Moses | Hazard, Costa, Pedro 
Substitutes from: Begovic, Terry, Zouma, Matic, Loftus-Cheek, Willian, Batshuayi 
--- Date / Time: Monday, March 6, 20:00 GMT; 3pm EST; 1:30am IST (next day) Venue: London Stadium, London, England Referee: Andre Marriner On TV: Sky Sports 1 (UK); NBCSN, NBC Universo (USA); Star Sports Select HD2 (India); elsewhere Streaming online: Sky Go (UK); NBC Sports Live Extra , NBC Universo Now (USA); Hotstar (India) 
--- 
In a bit of a surprise, Fabregas retains his place in the starting lineup for the third match running in all competitions. Rest as usual. 
Meanwhile, Andy Carroll returns from injury for the Hammers as expected. 
COME ON, CHELSEA!
